thread.title: T-Mobile reports 8.8 percent rise in quarterly revenue

title: T-Mobile reports 8.8 percent rise in quarterly revenue
text:
May 1, 2018 / 8:13 PM / Updated 18 minutes ago T-Mobile's quarterly revenue beats estimates Reuters Staff 2 Min Read
(Reuters) - Wireless carrier T-Mobile US Inc ( TMUS.O ), which is buying smaller rival Sprint Corp ( S.N ), topped Wall Street estimates for revenue as it added more postpaid phone subscribers with competitively priced plans. A sign for a T-Mobile store is seen in Manhattan, New York, U.S., April 30, 2018. REUTERS/Shannon Stapleton
Shares of the company rose 2 percent in after-market trading on Tuesday.
T-Mobile added 617,000 branded postpaid phone subscribers in the quarter, leading to an overall 1 million total branded postpaid net additions.
A deal between T-Mobile and Sprint will help T-Mobile boost its financials by creating a company with 127 million customers, making it a more formidable competitor to the top two wireless players, Verizon Communications Inc ( VZ.N ) and AT&T Inc ( T.N ).
The company’s revenue rose to $10.46 billion from $9.61 billion, beating the analysts’ average estimate of $10.35 billion, according Thomson Reuters I/B/E/S.
The company’s net income fell $671 million, or 78 cents a share, in the quarter ended March 31, from $698 million, or 80 cents a share, a year earlier. Reporting by Shariq Khan in Bengaluru; Editing by Arun Koyyur
